answers.answer: I was just reading about women with this and how they go for nst with movement and babies passed away within 72 hrs and now im terrified and crying uncontrollably. I don't know how I will deal with a full term baby dying. Omg

I am having my 6th child in March.  I have had gestational diabetes with 5 of my 6 pregnancies. I've carried all of my children full term without any complications. I am not sure of the reasoning behind your dr.'s decision's or the particulars behind your pregnancy, but I also did not have to have stress tests done on any of my pregnancies. Your Dr. may have other reasonings behind the stress tests that you aren't aware of. I would question everything,  what you can do to help you and the baby, a change in your diet, health style, share with your dr. Your weekly diet/health style,  so the dr. can have a better idea of what you can do if anything that can help minimize stress on the baby.If you are forced into early labor, know that everything will be ok. Try not to stress,  listen to calming music, watch a good movie show, pray, read your bible.  Just know everything will be ok. *HUGS*

question: So the doc has me coming in literally every 3 days until delivery for non stress test and ultrasound. They said today that  I probably won't make it to My due date of april 12. Anyone else have this happen?  How many weeks did you deliver?  Baby is 4 lbs currently and very long. I'm nervous. Help!
title: 32 weeks gestational diabetes. induce?
